# Draft:Mnawar J. Mohammed

Mnawar J. Mohammed (Arabic: منوّر ج. محمد) is a Lebanese copywriter, creative translator, and entrepreneur, recognized for his contributions to Arabic advertising and transcreation. He is the founder of CopyArabia, a Beirut-based content and transcreation agency established in 2014, which focuses on elevating the quality of Arabic commercial communication across the Middle East. Mohammed is also known for his books *Fundamentals of Copywriting* (2020) and *Fundamentals of Creative Translation* (2021), considered among the first systematic works in Arabic on advertising writing and transcreation.
Since beginning his career in 2003, Mohammed has worked with regional and international agencies in Beirut and Dubai, developing Arabic campaigns for multinational brands. His work and commentary have been featured in regional media outlets such as *ArabAd*, *Communicate Online*, and *Ahwal Media*, where he has discussed the importance of linguistic authenticity and the portrayal of gender in advertising.
Beyond his agency work, Mohammed is an educator and public speaker who has developed training programs for marketers, translators, and creative professionals. His initiatives and online courses aim to bridge cultural gaps in marketing communication and empower Arab talent to compete in international creative industries.
Career
Mohammed began his professional career in advertising in 2003, working with a range of multinational and regional agencies between Beirut and Dubai. After more than a decade in the industry, he founded CopyArabia in 2014, positioning it as a specialized Arabic copywriting and transcreation agency. The company’s mission centers on improving the quality of Arabic-language content in advertising and marketing, emphasizing cultural precision and stylistic depth.
As part of his advocacy for better Arabic communication, Mohammed launched the awareness campaign #ArabicComesFirst, encouraging agencies to prioritize Arabic-language quality and authenticity in creative work.
Publications
* Fundamentals of Copywriting (2020) – An instructional book on Arabic advertising copywriting, described by ArabAd magazine as the first of its kind in the Arab world.
* Fundamentals of Creative Translation (2021) – A guide distinguishing literal translation from creative adaptation for advertising. Al Joumhouria newspaper reported that the book helps copywriters and translators localize global campaigns to fit cultural nuances.
* Digital Marketing Secrets: Behind a Successful Campaign (2023) – A practical guide to building effective digital marketing strategies and campaign frameworks.
* A to Z Online Copywriting Course (2024) – An online training program designed to teach advertising writing techniques and creative communication for Arabic-speaking professionals.
Media Commentary
Mohammed has been cited in multiple interviews discussing the use of gender and stereotypes in advertising. In a 2020 interview with Ahwal Media, he commented that certain campaigns rely on controversy and outdated gender portrayals to gain attention, emphasizing the need for responsible creative direction.
